intro: Gutierrezia haenkei, commonly known as the desert gum plant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow, composite flower heads. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It is adapted to hot, dry climates and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions makes it an important component of its native ecosystem.
